STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 1, 2019
Sally Currie
Comprehensive Youth Services, Inc
Suite 103
2 Crocker Blvd
Mt Clemens, MI 48043
RE: License #: CI740201466
The Harbor
929 Pine St
Port Huron, MI 48060
Dear Ms. Currie:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
05/22/2019. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Implementation, Sustainability
and Exit Plan (ISEP) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the ISEP and your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
4th Floor, Suite 4B
51111 Woodward Avenue
Pontiac, MI 48342
(248) 860-3012
Enclosure:
Jeffery Oldham, License Designee
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
The agency is not a contract agency therefore, ISEP requirements does not
apply.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
The agency is not a contract agency therefore, DHHS/Contract policy does not
apply.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not offered technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility not was offered consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has not submitted any corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The facility is a short term Child Caring Institution that has not had any special
1

investigations nor were there any violations with any rules. The facility does not have
a contract.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that The Harbor continue on their regular license.
06/02/2019
